QAPair.Question: Do you have information about RBC indices
QAPair.Answer: Red blood cell (RBC) indices are part of the complete blood count (CBC) test. They are used to help diagnose the cause of anemia, a condition in which there are too few red blood cells. The indices include: Average red blood cell size (MCV), Hemoglobin amount per red blood cell (MCH), The amount of hemoglobin relative to the size of the cell (hemoglobin concentration) per red blood cell (MCHC) ,
